quote: Do you wish to find out the really sublime? Repeat the Lord's Prayer.
In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
A childish soul not inoculated with compulsory prayer is a soul open to any religious infection.
A prayer in its simplest definition is merely a wish turned Godward.
A simple grateful thought turned heavenwards is the most perfect prayer.
A single grateful thought toward heaven is the most perfect prayer.
About all I can say for the United States Senate is that it opens with a prayer and closes with an investigation.
Basically, I'm for anything that gets you through the night - be it prayer, tranquilizers or a bottle of Jack Daniels.
Battering the gates of heaven with the storms of prayer.
Coffee is good for talent, but genius wants prayer.
Do you wish to find out the really sublime? Repeat the Lord's Prayer.
In prayer it is better to have a heart without words than words without a heart.
A childish soul not inoculated with compulsory prayer is a soul open to any religious infection.
A prayer in its simplest definition is merely a wish turned Godward.
A simple grateful thought turned heavenwards is the most perfect prayer.
A single grateful thought toward heaven is the most perfect prayer.
About all I can say for the United States Senate is that it opens with a prayer and closes with an investigation.
Basically, I'm for anything that gets you through the night - be it prayer, tranquilizers or a bottle of Jack Daniels.
Battering the gates of heaven with the storms of prayer.
Coffee is good for talent, but genius wants prayer.
I don't know of a single foreign product that enters this country untaxed, except the answer to prayer.
I pray without ceasing now. My personal prayer is: Make me an instrument which only truth can speak.
If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
In my life, I have prayed but one prayer: oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it.
My prayer to God is a very short one: ''O Lord, make my enemies look ridiculous!'' God has granted it.
Practical prayer is harder on the soles of your shoes than on the knees of your trousers.
Prayer does not change God, but changes him who prays.
Prayer is a confession of one's own unworthiness and weakness.
Prayer is a groan.
Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
Prayer is the slender nerve that moves the muscle of omnipotence.
Prayer is the voice of faith.
Prayer requires more of the heart than of the tongue.
Prayer should be the key of the day and the lock of the night.
Prayer, among sane people, has never superseded practical efforts to secure the desired end.
Sometimes the answer to prayer is not that it changes life, but that it changes you.
The fewer the words, the better the prayer.
The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
The Lord's prayer contains the sum total of religion and morals.
The man who says his evening prayer is a captain posting his sentinels. He can sleep.
The sovereign cure for worry is prayer.
The torpid artist seeks inspiration at any cost, by virtue or by vice, by friend or by fiend, by prayer or by wine.
The wish to pray is a prayer in itself. God can ask no more than that of us.
There is no greater distance than that between a man in prayer and God.
To be a Christian without prayer is no more possible than to be alive without breathing.
To gather with God's people in united adoration of the Father is as necessary to the Christian life as prayer.
Under certain circumstances, profanity provides a relief denied even to prayer.
Who rises from prayer a better man, his prayer is answered.
Your cravings as a human animal do not become a prayer just because it is God whom you ask to attend to them.
Your prayer must be for a sound mind in a sound body.
